issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Eucalyptus does not read the security group information when Network interfaces are specified at instance launch time

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When running an instance in a VPC you can either specify a subnet and security group as top level options or as part of a network interface option.

Currently if a security group and subnet are specified then the subnet is passed as a network interface option but the security group is passed as a top level option:

{code}
#
# euca-run-instances -g sg-00000000 -s subnet-00000000 emi-00000000 --debug
2014-12-01 18:22:13,452 DEBUG   RunInstances parsed arguments: {'secondary_count': None, 'user_data': None, 'iam_profile': None, 'Placement.GroupName': None, 'EbsOptimized': None, 'RamdiskId': None, 'subnet': 'subnet-00000000', 'group': ['sg-00000000'], 'Monitoring.Enabled': None, 'ImageId': 'emi-00000000', 'KeyName': None, 'ClientToken': None, 'user_data_file': None, 'InstanceType': None, 'AddressingType': None, 'BlockDeviceMapping': [], 'secondary_address': None, 'user_data_force': None, 'InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior': None, 'NetworkInterface': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'KernelId': None, 'count': '1', 'security_token': None, 'url': None, 'Placement.Tenancy': None, 'Placement.AvailabilityZone': None, 'private_ip_address': None, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None, 'DisableApiTermination': None, 'region': None}
2014-12-01 18:22:13,452 INFO    Config finding global option default-region
2014-12-01 18:22:13,452 INFO    Config   novalue for default-region
2014-12-01 18:22:13,452 INFO    Config finding global option max-retries
2014-12-01 18:22:13,452 INFO    Config   novalue for max-retries
2014-12-01 18:22:13,452 INFO    Config finding global option timeout
2014-12-01 18:22:13,452 INFO    Config   novalue for timeout
2014-12-01 18:22:13,456 INFO    RunInstances parameters: {'SecurityGroupId.1': 'sg-00000000', 'NetworkInterface.1.SubnetId': 'subnet-00000000', 'ImageId': 'emi-00000000', 'Version': '2014-06-15', 'MaxCount': '1', 'Action': 'RunInstances', 'MinCount': '1', 'NetworkInterface.1.DeviceIndex': '0'}
....
{code}

Either top level options or network interface options should be used for the subnet and security group.

This issue can be worked around by explicitly using network interface options:

{code}
# euca-run-instances -a :0:subnet-00000000:::sg-00000000 emi-00000000 --debug
2014-12-01 18:29:52,570 DEBUG   RunInstances parsed arguments: {'secondary_count': None, 'user_data': None, 'iam_profile': None, 'Placement.GroupName': None, 'EbsOptimized': None, 'RamdiskId': None, 'subnet': None, 'group': [], 'Monitoring.Enabled': None, 'ImageId': 'emi-00000000', 'KeyName': None, 'ClientToken': None, 'user_data_file': None, 'InstanceType': None, 'AddressingType': None, 'BlockDeviceMapping': [], 'secondary_address': None, 'user_data_force': None, 'InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior': None, 'NetworkInterface': [{'SubnetId': 'subnet-00000000', 'DeviceIndex': 0, 'SecurityGroupId': ['sg-00000000']}], 'show_empty_fields': False, 'KernelId': None, 'count': '1', 'security_token': None, 'url': None, 'Placement.Tenancy': None, 'Placement.AvailabilityZone': None, 'private_ip_address': None, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None, 'DisableApiTermination': None, 'region': None}
2014-12-01 18:29:52,571 INFO    Config finding global option default-region
2014-12-01 18:29:52,571 INFO    Config   novalue for default-region
2014-12-01 18:29:52,571 INFO    Config finding global option max-retries
2014-12-01 18:29:52,571 INFO    Config   novalue for max-retries
2014-12-01 18:29:52,571 INFO    Config finding global option timeout
2014-12-01 18:29:52,571 INFO    Config   novalue for timeout
2014-12-01 18:29:52,575 INFO    RunInstances parameters: {'NetworkInterface.1.SecurityGroupId.1': 'sg-00000000', 'NetworkInterface.1.SubnetId': 'subnet-00000000', 'ImageId': 'emi-00000000', 'Version': '2014-06-15', 'MaxCount': '1', 'Action': 'RunInstances', 'MinCount': '1', 'NetworkInterface.1.DeviceIndex': '0'}
{code}

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-RunInstances.html
fields.summary: euca-run-instances uses inconsistent layout for subnet and security group options

comments.body: Since the problem arises from mixing top-level and interface-level parameters, the plan here is to use only interface-level parameters when launching into a subnet and only top-level parameters otherwise.

Fixed in commit {{266645c}}

To test this, try various combinations of the individual network-related options and network interfaces and then compare what it sends the server with what it sends in non-VPC situations.  When using VPC it should always supply all network-related info, particularly security groups, underneath network interface structures, while when not using VPC it should supply security group info at the top level instead.

Fix Verified Installed Packages Name : euca2ools Arch : noarch Version : 3.2.0 Release : 0.0.1640.14.20150108git94c0859.el6 When using VPC all network-related info is underneath network interface structures, while when not using VPC it should supply security group info at the top level instead. VPC {code} [root@a-25 tony_creds]# euca-run-instances -g sg-445ef257 -s subnet-e8d6f7cf emi-a71b03a5 --debug 2015-01-20 15:54:15,384 DEBUG RunInstances parsed arguments: {'secondary_count': None, 'user_data': None, 'iam_profile': None, 'Placement.GroupName': None, 'EbsOptimized': None, 'RamdiskId': None, 'subnet': 'subnet-e8d6f7cf', 'group': ['sg-445ef257'], 'Monitoring.Enabled': None,
